CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning - Viva App Bar integration in Viva Learning Webapp
CurrentVersion.description: Viva Learning Webapp will have an easy way to switch across other Viva Webapp modules.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning - Viva App Bar integration in Viva Learning Webapp
OldVersion.description: Viva Learning Webapp will have an easy way to switch across other Viva Webapp modules.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning - Spell check in Viva Learning search
CurrentVersion.description: User queries will be spell checked and corrected for all in-app Search.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning - Spell check in Viva Learning search
OldVersion.description: User queries will be spell checked and corrected for all in-app Search.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning -  Use the Egress API to access all “My Learning” records
CurrentVersion.description: The Egress API can be used by learners to view their My Learning records and corresponding course details.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Viva Learning -  Use the Egress API to access all “My Learning” records
OldVersion.description: The Egress API can be used by learners to view their My Learning records and corresponding course details.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Export Q&A Questions
CurrentVersion.description: Event organizers can now export questions that attendees asked as a .csv file to better understand the questions asked and general sentiment in a town hall or webinar.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Export Q&A Questions
OldVersion.description: Event organizers can now export questions that attendees asked as a .CSV file, in order to better understand the questions asked and general sentiment in a meeting or event.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft 365 app: Use sensitivity labels in Microsoft 365 apps when connected experiences are disabled
CurrentVersion.description: Your organization can now disable connected experiences for privacy concerns without impacting data security policies such as sensitivity labels. Services associated with Microsoft Purview (e.g. sensitivity labels and rights management) are no longer controlled by policy settings to manage privacy controls for Microsoft 365 Apps. Instead, these services will rely on their existing security admin controls in Purview portals.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft 365 app: Use sensitivity labels in Microsoft 365 apps when connected experiences are disabled
OldVersion.description: Your organization can now disable connected experiences for privacy concerns without impacting data security policies such as sensitivity labels. Services associated with Microsoft Purview (e.g. sensitivity labels and rights management) are no longer controlled by policy settings to manage privacy controls for Microsoft 365 Apps. Instead, these services will rely on their existing security admin controls in Purview portals.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Playlist Card on Viva Connections Dashboard
CurrentVersion.description: This feature allows tenant admins to create a card for a playlist to be accessed from the Viva Connections Dashboard.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Playlist Card on Viva Connections Dashboard
OldVersion.description: This feature allows tenant admins to create a card for a playlist to be accessed from the Viva Connections Dashboard.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Sensitivity label support for town hall and webinars (Premium)
CurrentVersion.description: This feature will now allow event organizers to set sensitivity labels for town halls and webinars. These labels are visible to organizers when creating an event instance once selected, and notify organizers if the details of the event being created are not valid for the selected sensitivity.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Sensitivity label support for town hall and webinars (Premium)
OldVersion.description: This feature will now allow event organizers to set sensitivity labels for town halls and webinars. These labels are visible to organizers when creating an event instance once selected, and notify organizers if the details of the event being created are not valid for the selected sensitivity.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Host and attendee interaction visibility for multi-room Mesh events
CurrentVersion.description: Mesh event attendees can now see raised hands and reactions from attendees in other rooms during large, multi-room Mesh events. This creates a greater sense of audience feedback as a whole across all rooms in a Mesh event and increases total audience engagement.  Additionally, event hosts will now be able to move between all rooms in a multi-room Mesh event.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Host and attendee interaction visibility for multi-room Mesh events
OldVersion.description: Mesh event attendees can now see raised hands and reactions from attendees in other rooms during large, multi-room Mesh events. This creates a greater sense of audience feedback as a whole across all rooms in a Mesh event and increases total audience engagement.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Work Hours and Location in My Day
CurrentVersion.description: Work Hours and Location information will now be available in My Day pane in Outlook when using agenda view. Users will be able to update their Work Hours and Location information from My Day and also see who is coming to Office. This feature will be available in the new Outlook for Windows and web. #newoutlookforwindows

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Microsoft Mesh app on PC supports guest access for events
CurrentVersion.description: Attendees can now join Mesh events as a guest in the Microsoft Mesh app on PC. Event organizers can invite guest users outside their organization, providing an opportunity for broader collaboration and networking in Mesh events. Guests can sign in to Mesh app to join events, participate in discussions, and experience the same interactive features as internal users, all while maintaining secure access control. Guest access for events in the Mesh app on Quest and support for anonymous participants will be supported in a future update.
